# Discord Chat Analysis: ðŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily focused on Hyperfy's collections/palettes system and camera functionality. Developers debated how to organize and share collections of assets, with 0mka and Ashxn discussing UI improvements for the current implementation. They explored the possibility of having multiple collection managers and importing/exporting collections. The conversation touched on plot/parcel permissions in shared worlds, with Ashxn suggesting that apps should only run scripts within their designated plots to prevent griefing.

Cru mentioned working on separating build/editor mode from play mode to create more focused experiences for both creators and players, potentially mounting the editor on a different URL while maintaining real-time updates. The goal is to create a professional dev experience comparable to Unity.

Later, vox offered 35,000 HYPER tokens for developing a versatile freecam with additional features. Shiffty shared code for a freecam implementation with 6DOF movement and mouse rotation control. The discussion evolved into camera path functionality, with drdoge.eth sharing a camera switcher implementation that allows clicking objects to move the camera to configurable positions.

## 2. FAQ
Q: What are your thoughts on how hyp packs are working? (asked by 0mka) A: They're currently called collections, with only one default collection in a folder in the repo. The UI could have tabs for each collection with buttons to create, edit, import and export collections. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: What's the easiest way to share collections? (asked by 0mka) A: You could modify the default folder and make it whatever you want and then share that with people if needed. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Have you tried to fetch or load a hyp from a URL? (asked by 0mka) A: One hyp can't load another hyp, but Eliza can simulate drag and drop by running the same function that loads a hyp. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: How would plots work in a single world where people can only build on certain plots? (asked by Ashxn) A: One approach would be using volumes, where anything within the volume applies to the permissions granted to users. (answered by TheMattEmpire)
